Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no pre-marked ballots for Hillary Clinton and other Democratic candidates were found in a warehouse in Ohio.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove the existence of pre-marked ballots in the warehouse.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the purpose of the pre-marked ballots was to slip them in with the real ballots, without providing any evidence for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the claim is false and the photograph used in the article was altered to support the false claim.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of pre-marked ballots, stating that "thousands" were found, while the actual article mentioned "approximately one dozen black, sealed ballot boxes filled with thousands of Franklin County votes."
Understate: There is no understatement bias in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting false information and relying on a source (Christian Times Newspaper) known for promoting conspiracy theories.
